title: Sample Book, ca. 1834
medium:
Medium: cardboard, paper, cotton
Technique: block and roller printed on plain weave
inscribed:
On inside cover and on fly leaf:  "Ship Plymouth Apl. 1 1834."
In faint pencil on fly leaf:  "J. F and Co.," and below "181."
dimensions: H x W x D (closed): 24.2 x 16.8 x 2 cm (9 1/2 x 6 5/8 x 13/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund
description: Oblong book with blue cardboard covers contains 46 samples of printed cotton; two have been cut in half.  Six individual patterns balance duplicates. Designs are small scale, printed mostly in bright red, blue green, and dark brown. Probably combination roller and block-printing.  No selvage.

tombstone.epitaph:
Sample Book, ca. 1834.
ca. 1834. Medium: cardboard, paper, cotton
Technique: block and roller printed on plain weave. Museum purchase from Pauline Riggs Noyes Fund. 1954-173-1.
